content.description:
The crux is moving to and past the last bolt.  A funky R hand pinch/Gaston enables one to slap a bad pocket on the arete and, thus, make it to the bucket flake on top.  Shuts are a bit off to the right, so TR climbing would be sketchy.  

  This is a fun route.  A great knee-bar rest can be found just before the serious climbing starts.
content.location: The route is on the wall immediately left of "The Flintstones " E-SE face goes into the shade fairly early.

content.description:
This route shares the first three bolts with Fred Flintstone, then goes right, staying on the face through some pockets and pinches.   

  It's a good way to get a little more value for your money than Fred since you're swapping the easy 4th class at the end for some thin climbing.

climbs.name: Jedi Mind Tricks
climbs.fa: Tim Maloney and Leo Henson (TR), Jeremy Nelson and Rob Tomczak (lead)

content.description: Follow the dihedral up to a bulge/roof (careful of some loose-looking rock.) Traverse right underneath the bulge and ascend a small corner (crux), then climb a long way on easy terrain to reach the anchors. Be sure to top it out and take in the scene.
content.protection: 12 bolts to chains. A 60m rope barely reaches - knot your rope before lowering or rappelling.
content.location: Rack up, then scramble up the gully to the right of Barney Rubble about 15-20 feet and walk right across the narrow ledge to reach the base of the route.

content.description: This is an good climb. It is fun for the first four bolts; steep and pumpy. IMHO the anchor should have been placed much lower, right after the last move exiting the bulge.As it is, you climb cool overhanging rock on buckets, enter the slot and with a new bolt you can finish up the prow for some 5.8 Climbing!
content.location: One of three climbs on the Bedrock bulge. Starts on a ledge in the alcove that is "Bedrock."

content.description:
This is a fun route.  Great climb to warm up or cool down on!  Buckets to the face, which stays on you all the way to the shuts.  Difficult to clean from the top; a second needs to follow to retrieve draws. 

  The route veers up and right around a roof/bulge and finishes on a vertical face.
content.location: In Bedrock proper; an alcove just to the right of The Shooting Gallery.  The climb starts on a ledge; boulder start to the beginning of a bulging roof.  Look for heavily pocketed, bulging face.

content.description: Bedrock is the steep, heavily pocketed cliff in the alcove right of The Shooting Gallery. This area includes two of The Pit's best moderates, Fred Flintstone and Barney Rubble (both 5.10b.)
